statusRangeList.7: [71,79] partons in preparation of hadronization process
statusRangeList.8: [81,89] primary hadrons produced by hadronization process
statusRangeList.9: [91,99] particles produced in decay process, or by Bose-Einstein effects
statusRangeList.10: [101,109] particles in the handling of R-hadron production and decay

statusList.24: outgoing, nonperturbatively kicked out in diffraction
statusList.45: incoming rescattered parton, with changed kinematics owing to ISR in the mother system
statusList.46: incoming copy of recoiler when this is a rescattered parton
statusList.47: a W or Z gauge boson produced in the shower evolution
statusList.52: outgoing copy of recoiler, with changed momentum
statusList.53: copy of recoiler when this is incoming parton, with changed momentum
statusList.54: copy of a recoiler, when in the initial state of a different system from the radiator
statusList.55: copy of a recoiler, when in the final state of a different system from the radiator
statusList.56: a W or Z gauge boson produced in a shower branching (special case of 51)
statusList.61: incoming subprocess particle with primordial kT included
statusList.62: outgoing subprocess particle with primordial kT included
statusList.64: copied particle with new colour according to the colour configuration of the beam remnant
statusList.71: copied partons to collect into contiguous colour singlet
statusList.72: copied recoiling singlet when ministring collapses to one hadron and momentum has to be reshuffled
statusList.73: combination of very nearby partons into one
statusList.74: combination of two junction quarks (+ nearby gluons) to a diquark (this index is not changed by recoils or recombinations)
statusList.75: gluons split to decouple a junction-antijunction pair
statusList.76: partons with momentum shuffled or a new colour to decouple junction-antijunction structures
statusList.77: temporary opposing parton when fragmenting first two strings in to junction (should disappear again)
statusList.78: temporary combined diquark end when fragmenting last string in to junction (should disappear again)
statusList.79: copy of particle with new colour indices after the colour reconnection
statusList.83: from normal string (the difference between 83 and 84 is technical, whether fragmented off from the top of the string system or from the bottom, useful for debug only)
statusList.84: from normal string (the difference between 83 and 84 is technical, whether fragmented off from the top of the string system or from the bottom, useful for debug only)
statusList.85: primary produced hadrons in junction fragmentation of the first two string legs in to the junction, in order of treatment
statusList.86: primary produced hadrons in junction fragmentation of the first two string legs in to the junction, in order of treatment
statusList.87: primary produced baryon from a junction
statusList.88: primary produced baryon from a junction
statusList.89: primary produced baryon from a junction in the ministring framework
statusList.92: decay products after oscillation B0 ↔ B0bar or B_s0 ↔ B_s0bar
statusList.93: decay handled by an external program, normally or with oscillation
statusList.94: decay handled by an external program, normally or with oscillation
statusList.95: a forced decay handled by an external program
statusList.96: a forced decay handled by an external program
statusList.99: particles with momenta shifted by Bose-Einstein effects
statusList.101: when a string system contains two such long-lived particles, the system is split up by the production of a new q-qbar pair
statusList.102: partons rearranged from the long-lived particle end to prepare for fragmentation from this end
statusList.103: intermediate 'half-R-hadron' formed when a colour octet particle (like the gluino) has been fragmented on one side, but not yet on the other
statusList.105: partons or particles formed together with the R-hadron during the fragmentation treatment
statusList.106: subdivision of an R-hadron into its flavour content, with momentum split accordingly, in preparation of the decay of the heavy new particle, if it is unstable
statusList.107: two temporary leftover gluons joined into one in the formation of a gluino-gluon R-hadron
